questions.question: What is a text file?
choices: A file that contains only text and no formatting
A file that contains images and text
A file that can only be opened with Microsoft Word
A file that contains executable code
questions.answer: A file that contains only text and no formatting

questions.question: Which of the following is a common text file extension?
questions.answer: .txt

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of using text files in programming?
choices: They are easily readable and editable by humans and computers
They can store large amounts of data
They are more secure than other file types
questions.answer: They are easily readable and editable by humans and computers

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common use for text files?
questions.answer: Saving high-resolution images

questions.question: What is encoding in the context of text files?
choices: The way characters are represented in the file
The process of compressing the file
The method of encrypting the file contents
The way the file is organized on the hard drive
questions.answer: The way characters are represented in the file

questions.question: Which encoding is widely used for English text files?
questions.answer: ASCII

questions.question: What does UTF-8 stand for?
questions.answer: Unicode Transformation Format - 8-bit

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using UTF-8 encoding?
choices: It can represent characters from most of the world's writing systems
It compresses the file to save space
It makes the file load faster in web browsers
questions.answer: It can represent characters from most of the world's writing systems

questions.question: What is a newline character used for in text files?
choices: To indicate the end of a line of text
questions.answer: To indicate the end of a line of text

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common text editor?
questions.answer: Photoshop

questions.question: What is the difference between a text editor and a word processor?
choices: Text editors work with plain text, while word processors include formatting options
Text editors are only for programming, while word processors are for writing documents
Text editors are free, while word processors are paid software
There is no difference between them
questions.answer: Text editors work with plain text, while word processors include formatting options

questions.question: Which of the following file types is NOT typically a text file?
questions.answer: .mp3

questions.question: What does CSV stand for in the context of text files?
questions.answer: Comma-Separated Values

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using text files for configuration settings?
choices: They are easily editable without special software
They provide better security than other file types
questions.answer: They are easily editable without special software

questions.question: What is the purpose of a BOM (Byte Order Mark) in text files?
choices: To indicate the encoding of the file
To mark the beginning of the file
questions.answer: To indicate the encoding of the file

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common issue when working with text files?
choices: File corruption due to cosmic rays
Large file sizes for long documents
questions.answer: File corruption due to cosmic rays

questions.question: What is the primary difference between .txt and .rtf files?
choices: .rtf files can include basic formatting, while .txt files cannot
.rtf files are more secure than .txt files
There is no difference between them
questions.answer: .rtf files can include basic formatting, while .txt files cannot

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using text files for logging?
choices: They are easily searchable and can be processed by other programs
They can store binary data efficiently
They are more secure than other logging methods
questions.answer: They are easily searchable and can be processed by other programs

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'carriage return' character in text files?
choices: To move the cursor to the beginning of the line
questions.answer: To move the cursor to the beginning of the line

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid way to represent a newline in text files?
questions.answer: \p

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of using escape characters in text files?
choices: To represent special characters or formatting
To create hyperlinks within the text
questions.answer: To represent special characters or formatting

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of using plain text files for source code?
choices: They can be easily version controlled
questions.answer: They can be easily version controlled

questions.question: What is the main difference between ANSI and Unicode encoding?
choices: Unicode supports a much larger character set
ANSI is newer and more efficient
Unicode is only for programming languages
ANSI supports more languages than Unicode
questions.answer: Unicode supports a much larger character set

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common use case for JSON files?
questions.answer: Storing executable code

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of an .ini file?
choices: To initialize a new programming project
To create a new text document
questions.answer: To store configuration settings

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the difference between binary files and text files?
choices: Text files contain human-readable characters, while binary files contain raw data
Binary files are smaller than text files
Text files can only be opened on Windows, while binary files work on all operating systems
Binary files are more secure than text files
questions.answer: Text files contain human-readable characters, while binary files contain raw data

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of using XML files over plain text files?
choices: XML provides a structured format for data
XML files are smaller in size
XML files can contain executable code
questions.answer: XML provides a structured format for data

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid text file operation?
questions.answer: Defragmenting

questions.question: What is the main purpose of using a .gitignore file in a project?
choices: To specify files that should not be tracked by Git
To list all files in the Git repository
To initialize a new Git repository
questions.answer: To specify files that should not be tracked by Git

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the purpose of a README file?
choices: To provide information about a project or software
To list all files in a directory
questions.answer: To provide information about a project or software
